column1: One evening as I was lying flat on the deck of my steamboat
column2: I heard voices approaching—and there were the nephew and the uncle strolling along the bank. I laid my head on my arm again
column3: and had nearly lost myself in a doze
column4: when somebody said in my ear
column5: as it were: 'I am as harmless as a little child
column6: but I don't like to be dictated to. Am I the manager—or am I not? I was ordered to send him there. It's incredible.' ... I became aware that the two were standing on the shore alongside the forepart of the steamboat
column7: just below my head. I did not move; it did not occur to me to move: I was sleepy. 'It is unpleasant
column8: ' grunted the uncle. 'He has asked the Administration to be sent there
column10: 'with the idea of showing what he could do; and I was instructed accordingly.
